reviews.text: A short walk from the main square, the hotel is in a great location. The exterior belies the modern interior, rooms and facilities. We visited with our children (aged 15, 13 and 11), and parents-in-law, and everyone was happy. From a very efficient welcome and check-in (even though we were early), to the service received during our 1 night stay, everything was first class. We had an adjoining room with our kids, which was a plus. The rooms were very comfortable with excellent bathrooms. The breakfast buffet set us up nicely for a day of sightseeing. The pool and sauna were a welcome escape from the snowy weather during our stay. All in all, I couldn't fault the hotel and its staff, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. In fact my sister is visiting the hotel in June.
reviews.title: The best reason for visiting Warsaw

reviews.text: Rooms are luxurious with many nice design details. Comfortable bed and very spacious bathroom with a nice shower. Large room with King size bed. Wifi works well. Service throughout the hotel is top knotch. The lobby area is inviting with many couches and chairs. High dining available in the small romantic restaurant. Perfect location right at the edge of old town in a quiet area. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful & charming boutique hotel in perfect location

reviews.text: The hotel is a few minutes walk from the attractions of the Old Town so makes a great location. Being on the edge of the Old Town it's in a quiet street close to restaurants.
reviews.title: Quality hotel on edge of Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very good- friendly, professional and informed.
reviews.title: Outstanding food, location & service

reviews.text: The room was well equipped and modern though the beds had 2 half duvets which weren't ideal and didn't make for a very good nights sleep.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having looked at the reviews on TA before booking and speaking on the forums, my wife opted for the Mamaison for our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly i'll start with the cost. If you can book in advance and take advantage of their non refundable rates, you will truly bag yourself a great deal. I managed to get a room here for only EUR60 per night. Ok, its not a flexible rate, but we knew we were going and were happy with the conditions.
reviews.title: Valentine stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions - from the drive from the Airport we thought the area looked very similar to alot of other central Europe destinations we had visited. in this particular part of the city there arent any highrise buildings, which i prefer, and also it was very quiet, again my preferece.
reviews.title: Top class

reviews.text: The building doesnt look out of place in the surrounding area and blends in well. The area has a lovely ambience about it, almost like you have the whole place to yourself at times.
reviews.title: Totally satisfied

reviews.text: The location - set at the end of the Royal Route, it first seems away from the action. But after a few minutes you notice that the walk from the hotel uncovers some fantastic places and buildings. The Old Town is literally less than 5 minutes walk away. There are some lovely places to eat, drink and rest here. I will cover my stay in a report later today.
reviews.title: Quiet, warm, and comfortable
Charming hotel in a good but quiet location
reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel. We also stayed at the Bristol. Le Regina is in a quiet location right outside of the Old City. The staff was really nice and the rooms were cozy. The whole place was charming. The restaurant is supposed to be quite good...we didnt have dinner there but the breakfast buffet was really really good. Breakfast was expensive but good. The wait staff was ok...not great. We would still stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Jan 2013. Our experience at the hotel was fantastic and we would highly recommend it as a base for your visit to Warsaw. The room was a great size and well equipped with a large bathroom (with powerful shower and large bath). The best part of the hotel stay was the swimming pool area, a great place to relax in a very warm pool. We asked for late checkout and they were very obliging at letting us stay a few more hours on the day of departure. The location is great for the Old Town (the tourist part of Warsaw), this was ideal, especially on an evening when you could walk to lots of local restaurants and bars. Taxi's to central Warsaw are cheap and the bus is an even cheaper option. Overall, a great, relaxed, peaceful stay.
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay in Warsaw

reviews.text: Very affordable hotel. Quite and luxury. The rooms are very comfy the food is delicious and prices are very affordable. Best stay in Warsaw. The hotel is within a walking distance to an old town. The breakfast was very delicious.
reviews.title: Very quite and luxury

reviews.text: Really enjoyed this hotel! It has a good location, spacious rooms, great reception staff, and free internet.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good but not amazing, the staff in the breakfast room/restaurant are not as great as the ones in the reception, but the restaurant has really really excellent food.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in Old Town

reviews.text: Tucked away on a quiet street in the charming old town, this hotel is a gem - apparently once the residence of the King's Head Chef! The staff are charming, the hotel is smartly appointed and our room was excellent. State of the art bathroom and the bed was unusually comfortable. The restaurant serves a very fine dinner and a hearty buffet in the morning. The location is particularly poignant given that the hotel stands all of 50 yards from the edge of the erstwhile Jewish ghetto (the location of the ghetto wall is marked in the pavement). You can get round most of the key sights in a weekend (we took a 3-hour private tour arranged by the hotel - not cheap but worth every penny) and the vibrance of the city is a testament to Warsaw's resilience in the face of the unspeakable horrors of its past. I defy anyone to come away from Warsaw unaffected by its story. Will definitely return...
reviews.title: Weekend in Warsaw

reviews.text: Location of this hotel is great, as you are walking distance to anything in the Old Town- it is in a quiet, quaint neighborhood. Our room was very comfortable, low-key. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and the general atmosphere of the hotel was cozy. Breakfasts were wonderful, however beware if you book through Expedia, because it is not included in the package price (which we only discovered on our second morning when presented a check for two breakfasts) Very nice restuarants in the area. The only drawback was that the spa area wasn't particularly well-maintained- the changing room was not very nice , no shampoos available in the showers (5-star hotel) and there was an unpleasant sewer water smell in a corner of the changing room. My aughter wanted to spend tome in the pool, but it did get quite crowded in the evenings. All things considered though, it was a very pleasant stay and we would return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: Lovely hotel perfectly situated for the Old Town. The rooms are nicely decorated and are spacious,the beds are so comfortable and the bathrooms are stunning. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. We did not eat in the Hotel due to the high cost of breakfast and the fact that
reviews.title: The Place To Stay In The Old Town

reviews.text: there are so many lovely restaurants and bars just a short walk away.Would recommend this hotel and would stay again if I ever visited Warsaw.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in Old Town Warsaw

reviews.text: Location of this hotel is great. It's about five minutes walking distance from the centre of Old Town. During our stay we walked to most of the attractions. The hotel is on a very quiet street and at night you won't hear a thing. What I liked most was the friendliness of the staff. We had never been to Warsaw before and when we asked about what we could do, we had three people from the staff standing in front of us giving us suggestions, discussing the pros and cons of certain restaurants, etc. Super helpful, super friendly. Breakfast buffet is superb as well. We paid roughly 70 euros including breakfast and for a hotel of that quality that's a great deal. Don't go to one of the big chain hotels in Warsaw, go to this one as it is very personal yet high quality and very very attentive service.
reviews.title: Tranquil stay in Warsaw
